dt: {bc}a flat or curved piece of fired clay, stone, or concrete used especially for roofs, floors, or walls and often for ornamental work
{bc}a hollow or a semicircular and open earthenware or concrete piece used in constructing a drain
{bc}a hollow building unit made of fired clay or of shale or gypsum
{bc}a thin piece of resilient material (such as cork, linoleum, or rubber) used especially for covering floors or walls
{bc}a thin piece resembling a ceramic tile that usually bears a mark or letter and is used as a playing piece in a board game (such as mah-jongg)

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}tigele{/it}, from Latin {it}tegula{/it} tile; akin to Latin {it}tegere{/it} to cover {ma}{mat|thatch|}{/ma}
shortdef: a flat or curved piece of fired clay, stone, or concrete used especially for roofs, floors, or walls and often for ornamental work
a hollow or a semicircular and open earthenware or concrete piece used in constructing a drain
a hollow building unit made of fired clay or of shale or gypsum
